patterns: How many students are placed?
What is the average package?
What is the placement rate ?
What is the median package of B.Tech at Vardhaman College of Engineering?
Does Vardhaman College of Engineering provide good placement facilities?
responses: Around 80% of students get placed in our course because it is a new course. Many opportunities are provided in our course. The highest salary package offered is 25 LPA, the lowest salary package is 3 LPA, and the average salary package is 5 LPA. The recruiting companies are Tech Mahindra and Microsoft. Around 80% of students get internships in our course.

Almost 85% of students got placed in different companies. The highest salary package offered is 55 LPA. The average salary package offered is 5 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Amazon, TCS, Capgemini, Cognizant, etc. Almost 70% of students got internships from our college at Infosys, Tech Mahindra, Oracle, etc.

The placements are one of the best in our college. The number of students placed is around 80 percent. The average package is 5 Lacs per annum. Moreover, the placement cell ensures to get everyone placed or being part of the placement season. The companies like Deloitte, tcs, ADP, etc. Has come to our college for placements.

80% of students have got placed in various companies related to a variety of fields. The highest package offered was 50LPA, the lowest was 3LPA and the average is about 5LPA. Companies like TCS, Infosys, Wipro, LTI Mindtree, Cognizant, Capgemini, Accenture, Amazon, Flipkart, etc. Were the major recruiters. More than 40% of the students have got internships in several companies like BHEL, BDL, TCS, Riktam Technologies, etc. The top roles offered to any student in my course are Software Development Engineer and Associate Software Engineer.

patterns: college infrastructure?
How is the college infrastructure ?
How does the college infrastructure affect the student learning experience?
responses: The infrastructure of our college is the best. Our college has a good atmosphere. All the drawing halls, classrooms, laboratories, engineering workshops, seminar halls, sports rooms, indoor games, and a library are available in our college. The library is an independent building with a huge number of books sharing lots of knowledge. There are separate hostels for girls and boys, which can accommodate over 300 students. The hostel students can avail of all necessary facilities like Wi-Fi, a television, air-conditioned rooms, and yoga sessions. Food served is good and we have the best hostel ever.

Laboratory and infrastructure of our college were good. Students can use laboratories for their research and learning purposes. The quality of the facilities in the hostel was good. The quality of the food was very good.

The classrooms are highly modernised and decent in their kind. The campus is quite bigger and has a good security in it. The cafeteria has one of the best food and is the source of lunch to many people. There is a separate department for medical concern. Sports and games are not daily part of curriculum but are invoked when selections are made for competitions.

There are six blocks. Infrastructure and facilities are well-developed in each block. There are two auditoriums and a library with a very peaceful environment for students. There is an indoor stadium for different sports. There is a separate cricket stadium for students.

The teachers in our course are very knowledgeable and also helpful. Many of the teachers are qualified PhDs in our college. The teaching quality is highly efficient. Our course curriculum is mostly related to industrial-level knowledge. The semester exams are always quite challenging. Scoring well in all exams is a hard row to hoe. The pass percentage is 70%.
Our faculty members are excellent with students. They are well-experienced and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is useful for students to be industry-ready.

patterns: What is the major and a minor course?
What are the core courses
What are the elective courses
responses: A major and a minor are both academic programs that students can pursue at colleges and universities. However, they differ in their scope and focus.

Core courses are the foundational classes that students must take in order to complete their degree program. They are designed to provide students with a broad understanding of the subject matter and to prepare them for more advanced coursework. Core courses are usually required for all students in a particular major, regardless of their specific interests or career goals.

Elective courses are the courses that students choose to take in addition to their core courses. They are designed to allow students to explore their interests, develop specialized skills, or prepare for a particular career path. Elective courses can be chosen from a wide range of disciplines, including the arts, humanities, sciences, social sciences, and professional fields.

patterns: What is an autonomous college?
What are the benefits of attending an autonomous college?
How do autonomous colleges maintain high academic standards?
responses: An autonomous college is a higher education institution that has a high degree of self-governance and independence from its parent university or university system. This means that autonomous colleges have the freedom to make their own decisions about curriculum, faculty hiring, and other matters that typically fall under the purview of the parent institution.

Autonomous colleges typically enjoy greater flexibility in their approach to education, allowing them to innovate and adapt to the needs of their students and the community. They may also have more resources to invest in faculty development, research, and student support services.

Autonomous colleges and non-autonomous colleges differ in terms of their governance structure, decision-making authority, and level of independence.Autonomous colleges have the flexibility to pursue international partnerships, exchange programs, and study abroad opportunities. They can connect with institutions worldwide, providing students with the chance to study abroad, gain global exposure, and enhance their cross-cultural understanding.

responses: The annual day of Vardhaman College of Engineering, also known as ORTUS, is a grand celebration of the college's achievements and the talents of its students. The event is held in the month of March or April every year and attracts a large number of participants and spectators.

ORTUS features a variety of events, including dance performances, singing competitions, skits, and fashion shows. The event also includes a cultural parade, where students from different departments showcase their traditional attire and dance forms.

ORTUS is a major event in the college calendar and is a source of pride for the college community. The event is a great opportunity for students to showcase their talents and to interact with each other.

It is a two-day event that is held in the month of March or April every year. The festival features a variety of events, including dance performances, singing competitions, skits, and fashion shows. The event also includes a cultural parade, where students from different departments showcase their traditional attire and dance forms.

responses: Vardhaman College of Engineering has two auditoriums, one with a seating capacity of 1200 and the other with a seating capacity of 600. Both auditoriums are air-conditioned and soundproof. They are equipped with modern audiovisual equipment, including projectors, screens, and sound systems. The auditoriums are used for a variety of events, including lectures, seminars, conferences, and cultural programs. The larger auditorium is used for large events, such as convocation ceremonies and guest lectures by prominent speakers. The smaller auditorium is used for smaller events, such as departmental seminars and student presentations. Both auditoriums are well-maintained and provide a comfortable and conducive environment for events.

Vardhaman College of Engineering has two auditoriums, a 1200-seater and a 600-seater. The 1200-seater auditorium is called the Mega Auditorium, and it is located in the main building of the college. The 600-seater auditorium is called the AC Auditorium, and it is located in the library building.

The Wi-Fi network is powered by dedicated leased lines of 1500 MBPS (1300 MBPS from INet Fiber Ltd and 200 MBPS from Reliance Jio InfoCom Ltd). The network is secure and uses WPA2 encryption. The Wi-Fi network is a valuable resource for students, faculty, and staff. It allows them to connect to the internet anywhere on campus, which is essential for research, learning, and communication.
